abstract: Citizens in Massachusetts are gathering signatures in hopes of placing a "death with dignity" law on the ballot.
snippet: Citizens in Massachusetts are gathering signatures in hopes of placing a "death with dignity" law on the ballot.
lead_paragraph: Most fall weekends, you can find Randee Laikind buttonholing people at the Shelburne Falls Market in western Massachusetts, or wielding her clipboard on the town common in nearby Greenfield or Amherst.
